NCII Certificate (CSS)

An NCII (National Certificate Level II) is a certification issued by the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (TESDA) in the Philippines, verifying an individual's competency in a specific trade or occupation. It signifies that the holder has successfully completed a training program and passed a competency assessment, demonstrating the necessary skills and knowledge for that trade.

VERIFY

Foundations and Reconnaissance Techniques

Through Coursera, I developed the persistence, creativity, and analytical skills necessary to identify vulnerabilities and execute structured attacks under tight time constraints, aligning with OSCP-level capabilities. They can:

  • Leverage information gathering to identify and enumerate targets
  • Develop and use custom scripts to support the penetration testing process
  • Adapt and utilize publicly available exploit code
  • Escalate privileges and exploit client-side vulnerabilities

(Evaluation) Penetration Testing, Threat Hunting, and Cryptography

As a holder of the IBM Penetration Testing, Threat Hunting, and Cryptography Certificate, I demonstrate foundational knowledge in ethical hacking, proactive threat detection, and cryptographic security. This includes the ability to conduct penetration tests, hunt for advanced threats within networks, and apply cryptographic techniques to protect dataâ€”while adhering to cybersecurity best practices and maintaining operational integrity.

VERIFY

(SOON) CompTia PenTest+

CompTIA PenTest+ certification have the knowledge and skills necessary to perform hands-on penetration testing to identify, exploit, report, and manage vulnerabilities on a network. CompTIA PenTest+ professionals have demonstrated the hands-on ability and knowledge to test devices in new environments such as the cloud and mobile, in addition to traditional desktops and servers.
